summary: The Surface Transportation Weather Safety Gap Analysis Act of 2025 mandates a joint study by the Comptroller General and the Secretary of Transportation to examine weather-related hazards and safety gaps in surface transportation. The study will evaluate existing programs, state practices, emergency management roles, resource constraints, cost-benefit estimates, privacy issues, and best practices. The findings, including recommendations for legislative or administrative action, will be reported to relevant congressional committees within two years of the Act's enactment.
